CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper January 25, 1947, pg. 17, reads: "Inselric [Inselbric] for White GI's - This show shows a row of houses in the sixty-five-home Malmade Village for white GI's in Clairton. City of Clairton purchased these houses from the Government for emergency housing for Uncle Sam's boys. Interior of "white" houses is same as that of the houses for Negroes, but the exteriors present a different picture. Allegheny Housing Authority is managing both projects for the city of Clairton but insists that segregation policy stems from Clairton's Mayor Mullens and City Council. No one "knows" why there is no inselbric for Negro houses. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: One story houses with Insulbrick siding, future homes of white only veterans in Malmade Village, Clairton, Pennsylvania
